description:
On March 13, the Central Election Board of the Dominican Republic adopted several measures for the March 15 elections. Election officials will:

1. Streamline the mobility of voters to avoid crowds in public spaces around polling stations.
2. Prioritize in the voting process those who require it according to their physical condition as is traditionally done, but on this occasion, include people who present respiratory manifestations.
3. Facilitate that within the precincts voters stay one meter away to reduce exposure to respiratory secretions.
4. Provide the officials and delegates in the electoral precincts with the conditions for hand hygiene (washing or use of alcohol-based solution over 65%).
5. As a preventive measure, substitute officials or delegates who have fever or respiratory manifestations.
